metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4139 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An incorrect TLB flush issue was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s GPU i915 kernel driver, potentially leading to random memory corruption or data leaks. This flaw could allow a local user to crash the system or escalate their privileges on the system. It was discovered that the Intel i915 graphics driver in the Linux kernel did not perform a GPU TLB flush in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code.

notes.Note: cengizcan> Although announced break commit was backported to all v4.4 and up, actual CVE does not affect anything below v5.4 because i915 Gen 12 is not supported until v5.4.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
